item.title: Securing Redis with Istio TLS origination
item.description:
Istio is daunting and not all use cases are well documented. The public docs focus mostly on using the egress gateway for TLS orignation. The use case of using the sidecar for TLS origination with a database isn't documented well. This blog post hopes to solve that.

So you've actually …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Deploying OpenStack on GCP
item.description: You want private cloud inside public cloud for additional security, improved agility, lower opex and ultimate flexibility? I present you OpenStack running on Google Compute Engine (GCE). I hope you got the joke, if not, let me explain there are no benefits to running OpenStack on GCP. OpenStack on GCP …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Creating L2 connectivity between GCE VMs in GCP using VXLAN
item.description: Cloud providers often prevent you from using L2 protocols such as ARP. These protocols however are heavily used in existing software such as keepalived. This can make it hard for to move certain workloads to the cloud. This blog post demonstrates a method for creating L2 connectivity between Virtual Machines …

item.title: Fuel: Separate Ceph Public from Management using Network Templates
item.description: This post will demonstrate using Network Templates in Fuel to separate Ceph Public Network from Management Network. By default Fuel combines the ceph public network with the management network. The Ceph Public network is used for communicating from the compute nodes to the Ceph nodes. So in high performant storage …

item.title: Creating a KVM VM for StackLight on Fuel 8.0 master node
item.description: Creating a KVM VM on the Fuel master node is a nice way to better utilize server resources for small environments that were deployed already without using Fuel compact install or running Fuel as VM itself. We can run Controller, Monitoring or MongoDB as VM on the Fuel node. This …

item.title: Running Computer Vision algos on Spark with OpenCV
item.description:
This post shows several computer vision steps implemented on top of Spark. OpenCV is used to extract features on top of OpenStack and Spark MLLib KMeans is used to generate our KMeans dictionary. Then we use Spark and simple vector / matrix manipulation to do coding and pooling.

Workflow implemented using …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Elastic Data Processing on OpenStack with Spark, Tachyon and Swift
item.description:
This post will describe how to configure, build and deploy Spark with Tachyon and Swift as storage. This architecture is meant to be more suitable for running Big Data workloads on top of the cloud such as OpenStack.

Using Swift as storage layer for Spark gives us the ability to …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Setup IPv6 in Tsinghua on Linux(ArchLinux))
item.description:
Tsinghua university uses ISATAP to provide IPv6 connectivity to students. In Linux you can use the isatapd program to create an ISATAP tunnel based on an IPv4 device.

You can use the isatapd command as follows to establish an ISATAPD tunnel:

isatapd --router isatap.tsinghua.edu.cn

After connecting check …

item.title: Docker get private ip address of container
item.description:
In order to access other containers from a container it's needed to get the private IP address of the other containers. The following command is able to get the private ip address of the container.

$ docker inspect --format="{{.NetworkSettings.IPAddress}}" $CONTAINER_ID_OR_NAME
172.17.0.15
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Docker Multiple websites/domains on single ip/host tutorial using a HAproxy as reverse proxy
item.description:
This post will describe how to expose multiple docker containers running websites on port 80 using HAproxy as a reverse proxy. This makes it possible to run multiple websites on different domains on a single public ip of the host.

The basic setup is to create 1 container for haproxy …

item.title: SSH to server behind a firewall via an SSH tunnel
item.description:
A server behind a firewall was unaccesible from my home, but another server which is on the same local network had public SSH access from my home. So we can create an SSH tunnel via this public server to the server behind a firewall.

item.description:

The Karatsuba algorithm is a fast multiplication algorithm. It's special because it was the first multiplication algorithm …

item.title: Remove/detach a PCI device linux (kvm VGA passthrgough Nvidia Quadro 2000)
item.description:
Answer: 

echo -n "1" > /sys/bus/pci/devices/0000:02:00.0/remove

Where 0000:02:00.0 is related to your pci device address which can be obtained from the command lspci

Related story:
Was working on KVM vga passthrough and encountered problems with the graphics card nvidia Quadro …

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: setup.py

It seems they didn't package it well and it's using configure.py to install. So …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Ignoring every channels join/part/quit messages in IRSSI
item.description:
Tired of all those join part messages?

/ignore \* joins  
/ignore \* parts  
/ignore \* quits  
/save

Read more about ignore /help ignore

Taken from Archwiki: https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Irssi
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Create tar archive of changed/added files in a git commit
item.description:
The following command first gets the changed and added files of a git commit and then creates a tar archive of those changed files.

git show {{COMMIT_ID}} --name-status | grep -Ew '^M|A' | awk '{ print $2 }' | xargs tar czf usb-passthrough.tar.gz
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Using Sendgrid with Django on Heroku (How to find your Sendgrid password on Heroku)
item.description:
While setting up sentgrid I was searching for my password of sendgrid, but coudn't find it. You can get it in the following way:

heroku config --long

Which will show the parameters:
SENDGRID_PASSWORD, SENDGRID_USERNAME

After you get your username don't forget to add it to django settings: 

EMAIL\_HOST = 'smtp …

item.title: Django Custom View Decorator with Arguments
item.description:
To make my life easier I made a simple decorator which checks if the parameters are present in the request.POST or request.GET and returns a response if they are not.

It accepts a list of parameters in string format and will loop through each parameter to check if …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Simple function to return json in Django
item.description:
Just a small code snippet I use when I need to return json, comments are welcomed.

from django.http import HttpResponse  
from django.utils import simplejson as json

def json_response(dict_to_convert_to_json):  
    return HttpResponse(json.dumps(dict_to_convert_to_json),
                        mimetype="application/json")

To use it in your view you just do it this …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Chinese New Year 2012
item.description: The Chinese New Year aka Spring Festival is the most important festival in Chinese culture. All the people travel back to their hometown, because most of them are working/studying in cities far from their own hometown. That means all train tickets are sold the day they get available and …
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Importing a SQL dump in postgres
item.description:
I always keep forgetting how to import a SQL dump into postgres and found it always hard to find the right documentation. So I thought lets share it:

psql -d dbname -U username -f dumpfile.sql

This should also work with files created by pgdump.
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Installing fastboot for Ubuntu (Linux)
item.description:
mkdir ~/fastboot  
cd ~/fastboot  
wget http://xt720.ru/Tools/fastboot  
chmod +x fastboot  
sudo ./fastboot --help

Reference: http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1121420

I tested the above with Ubuntu 11.10, but it should work on any ubuntu version I think.
item.dc:creator: Sam Stoelinga

item.title: Ubuntu 11.10 error while loading shared libraries: libssl.so.0.9.8: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
item.description:
A quick solution is to install the libssl 0.9.8 package with the Following command:
sudo apt-get install libssl0.9.8

Thanks to Rob who commented below and provided an answer on Stackoverflow
